means: 有不可思议的力量之物

sentence.Network_en: Talisman, Talisman, show me your secrets.
sentence.Network_cn: 护身符, 护身符, 请把玄机告诉我.

sentence.Network_en: Quick as a wink , the lamemouse snatched up the precious talisman.
sentence.Network_cn: 说时迟那时快, 跛足的老鼠一把抓住宝贵的法宝.

sentence.Network_en: I am their lucky talisman; my business has never been so good.
sentence.Network_cn: 我是他们命运保护神, 我的生意从来也没这么好过.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: based on Arabic ṭilsam, apparently from an alteration of late Greek telesma 'completion, religious rite', from telein 'complete, perform a rite', from telos 'result, end'

entry.def: A talisman is an object which you believe has magic powers to protect you or bring you luck.

means.word_mean: 1. a trinket or piece of jewelry thought to be a protection against evil
